title: Rogozin puts poison-pill conditions on OneWeb Soyuz launch
summary: This week’s Soyuz launch of a set of OneWeb satellites has been thrown into doubt after Russia made new demands on the company.

title: Russia places extraordinary demands on OneWeb prior to satellite launch
summary: Cooperation in space among Russia and the West has been stripped to the bone.

title: Russian sanctions throw South Korean satellite missions into uncertainty
summary: South Korea, at least for now, is pushing forward with its planned launch of two satellites on Russian rockets this year. Still, it doesn’t rule out the possibility that the missions could be delayed due to sanctions imposed on Russia for invading Ukraine.

title: CesiumAstro raises $60 million in Series B funding round
summary: CesiumAstro Inc. raised $60 million in a Series B funding round led by Airbus Ventures and Forever Ventures.

title: Romania signs the Artemis Accords
summary: Romania became the 16th country to sign the NASA-led Artemis Accords for cooperation in space exploration March 1.

title: SpaceX prepares third Falcon 9 booster for eleventh launch and landing
summary: SpaceX has confirmed that Falcon 9 is on track to launch another batch of Starlink satellites less than 48 hours after a...

title: Congress presses NASA for more details on Artemis costs and schedules
summary: Members of Congress, concerned about growing costs and slipping schedules, pressed NASA for more details about the management and overall strategy of the agency’s Artemis lunar exploration plan.

title: Finally, we know production costs for SLS and Orion, and they’re wild
summary: Someone finally said the quiet part out loud.

title: Lockheed Martin plots U.K. satellite manufacturing base
summary: Lockheed Martin is looking to set up a satellite manufacturing base in the United Kingdom to expand its global space business, the U.S.-based aerospace and defense giant said March 1.

title: Ohio Students to Hear from NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station
summary: Students from across the state of Ohio will have an opportunity this week to hear from NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.
